title: Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani)
ingredients: 800g Chicken thighs, boneless, cut into chunks
steps: Mix yogurt, lemon juice, garam masala, turmeric, chili powder, ginger-garlic paste, and salt in a bowl. Add chicken chunks and coat well. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight.
Heat a grill pan or skillet over high heat. Cook the marinated chicken for 3-4 minutes per side until charred and cooked through. Set aside.
In a large pan, melt 4 tablespoons butter over medium heat. Add finely chopped onion and sauté for 5-7 minutes until soft and golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute until fragrant. Add tomato puree and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens and oil separates.
Add garam masala, Kashmiri chili powder, and honey. Stir well and cook for 2 minutes.
Lower the heat and stir in the heavy cream. Mix until smooth and creamy. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the grilled chicken pieces to the sauce. Simmer for 5-7 minutes, allowing the chicken to absorb the flavors.
Garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve hot with naan bread or basmati rice. The dish should be rich, creamy, and perfectly balanced between tangy and sweet.

title: Chicken Biryani
ingredients: Whole spices: 4 cloves, 2 bay leaves, 1 cinnamon stick, 4 cardamom pods
Saffron soaked in 1/4 cup warm milk
steps: Wash and soak basmati rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Heat 2 tablespoons ghee in a large pot. Fry sliced onions until golden brown and crispy. Remove half for garnish.
To the remaining onions, add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 1 minute. Add chicken pieces and cook for 5 minutes until sealed.
Add yogurt, tomatoes, turmeric, biryani masala, chili powder, and salt. Cook for 15 minutes until chicken is tender and oil separates. Add mint, cilantro, and green chilies.
In a separate large pot, boil 6 cups of water with whole spices and salt. Add the soaked rice and cook until 70% done (rice should still have a bite). Drain immediately.
Layer the biryani: Spread half the chicken gravy in a heavy-bottomed pot. Top with half the rice. Add the remaining chicken and cover with the remaining rice.
Drizzle saffron milk and remaining ghee over the top. Sprinkle the reserved fried onions.
Cover the pot tightly with aluminum foil, then the lid. Cook on high heat for 3 minutes, then reduce to low and cook for 25 minutes (dum cooking).
Turn off heat and let it rest for 5 minutes. Gently mix before serving. Serve hot with raita and pickle. The rice should be fragrant, fluffy, and each grain separate.

title: Palak Paneer (Spinach with Cottage Cheese)
steps: Blanch spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes. Immediately transfer to ice water to preserve the green color. Drain and blend to a smooth puree with green chilies. Set aside.
Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a pan. Lightly fry paneer cubes until golden on all sides. Remove and soak in warm water to keep soft.
In the same pan, heat remaining oil. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute. Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, and salt. Cook until tomatoes are soft and oil separates, about 8 minutes.
Add the spinach puree and mix well. Cook for 5 minutes on medium heat, stirring occasionally.
Add garam masala and cream. Mix well and simmer for 3 minutes.
Gently add the fried paneer cubes. Simmer for 2-3 minutes to let the paneer absorb the flavors.
Serve hot with naan or roti. The dish should be vibrant green, creamy, and the paneer should be soft and flavorful.

title: Vegetable Samosas
ingredients: For filling: 3 Potatoes, boiled and mashed
steps: Make the dough: Mix flour, salt, and oil until crumbly. Gradually add water and knead into a firm dough. Cover and rest for 30 minutes.
Make the filling: Heat 2 tablespoons oil. Add cumin seeds and let splutter. Add ginger, green chili, and peas. Cook for 3 minutes.
Add mashed potatoes, garam masala, coriander powder, turmeric, and salt. Mix well and cook for 5 minutes. Add cilantro and let cool.
Divide dough into 8 balls. Roll each into an oval, cut in half to make 2 semi-circles.
Form a cone with each semi-circle, sealing the edge with water. Fill with 2 tablespoons of potato filling. Seal the top edge firmly.
Heat oil for deep frying to 170°C (340°F). Fry samosas in batches for 8-10 minutes until golden and crispy, turning occasionally.
Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with tamarind chutney and mint chutney. The samosas should be crispy outside with a flavorful, spiced potato filling.

title: Mango Lassi
steps: Add chopped mangoes, yogurt, milk, sugar, and cardamom powder to a blender.
Blend on high speed for 1-2 minutes until smooth and creamy. The mixture should be thick but pourable.
Taste and adjust sweetness if needed. If too thick, add more milk.
Add ice cubes and blend again for 30 seconds until frothy.
Pour into tall glasses. Garnish with saffron strands if desired.
Serve immediately. Mango lassi should be cold, creamy, and refreshing with the perfect balance of sweet mango and tangy yogurt.
